#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=SKIPPED TO CANADA
#Text=Rumors have been rife for some time affecting the business standing of Mr. Benjamin Fielding , the well known commission merchant .
#Text=Yesterday it was discovered that he had left the city , but where he has gone is unknown .
#Text=It is believed that he is very deeply involved , and seeing no way out of his embarrassment has skipped to Canada , or perhaps taken passage to Europe .
#Text=Probably his creditors will appoint a committee to look into his affairs and report what can be done .
#Text=LATER --
#Text=An open letter has been found in Mr. Fielding ’s desk , addressed to his creditors .
#Text=It expresses regret for their losses , and promises , if his life is spared , and fortune favors him , to do all in his power to make them good .
#Text=No one doubts Mr. Fielding ’s integrity , and regrets are expressed that he did not remain in the city and help unravel the tangle in which his affairs are involved .
#Text=He is a man of ability , and as he is still in the prime of life , it may be that he will be able to redeem his promises and pay his debts in full , if sufficient time is given him .
#Text=“ I can get no help or advice from Mr. Fielding , ” thought Rodney .
#Text=“ I am thrown upon my own resources , and must fight the battle of life as well as I can alone . ”
#Text=He got out in front of the Astor House .
#Text=As he left the car he soiled his shoes with the mud so characteristic of New York streets .
#Text=“ Shine your boots ? ” asked a young Arab , glancing with a business eye at Rodney ’s spattered shoes .

#Text=Rodney accepted his offer , not so much because he thought the blacking would last , as for the opportunity of questioning the free and independent young citizen who was doing , what he hoped to do , that is , making a living for himself .
#Text=“ Is business good with you ? ” asked Rodney .
#Text=“ It ought to be with the street in this condition . ”
#Text=“ Yes ; me and de Street Commissioner is in league together .
#Text=He makes business good for me . ”
#Text=“ And do you pay him a commission ? ” asked Rodney smiling .
#Text=“ I ca n’t tell no official secrets .
#Text=It might be bad for me . ”
#Text=“ You are an original genius . ”
#Text=“ Am I ?
#Text=I hope you ai n’t callin ’ me names . ”
#Text=“ Oh no .
#Text=I am only paying you a compliment .
#Text=What is your name ? ”
#Text=“ Mike Flynn . ”
#Text=“ Were do you live , Mike ? ”
#Text=“ At the Lodge . ”
#Text=“ I suppose you mean at the Newsboys ’ ‘ Lodge ? ’ ”
#Text=“ Yes . ”
#Text=“ How much do you have to pay there ? ”
#Text=“ Six cents for lodgin ’ , and six cents for supper and breakfast . ”
#Text=“ That is , six cents for each . ”
#Text=“ Yes ; you ai n’t comin ’ to live there , are you ? ” asked Mike .
#Text=“ I do n’t know -- I may have to . ”
#Text=“ You ’re jokin ’ . ”
#Text=“ What makes you think I am joking ? ”
#Text=“ Because you ’re a swell .
#Text=Look at them clo’es ! ”
#Text=“ I have a good suit of clothes , to be sure , but I have n’t much money .
#Text=You are better off than I am . ”
#Text=“ How ’s that ? ” asked Mike incredulously .
#Text=“ You ’ve got work to do , and I am earning nothing . ”
#Text=“ If you ’ve got money enough to buy a box and brush , you can go in with me . ”
#Text=“ I do n’t think I should like it , Mike .
#Text=It would spoil my clothes , and I am afraid I would n’t have money enough to buy others . ”
#Text=“ I keep my dress suit at home -- the one I wear to parties . ”
#Text=“ Have n’t you got any father or mother , Mike ?
#Text=How does it happen that you are living in New York alone ? ”
#Text=“ My farder is dead , and me mudder , she married a man wot ai n’t no good .
#Text=He ’d bate me till I could n’t stand it .
#Text=So I just run away . ”
#Text=“ Where does your mother live ? ”
#Text=“ In Albany . ”
#Text=“ Some time when you earn money enough you can ask her to come here and live with you . ”
#Text=“ They do n’t take women at the Lodge . ”
#Text=“ No , I suppose not , ” said Rodney , smiling .
#Text=“ Besides she ’s got two little girls by her new husband , and she would n’t want to leave them . ”
#Text=By this time the shine was completed , and Rodney paid Mike .
#Text=“ If I ever come to the Lodge , I ’ll ask for you , ” he said .
#Text=“ Where do you live now ? ”
#Text=“ I ’m just staying at a place on Fourteenth Street , but I ca n’t afford to stay there long , for they charge a dollar a day . ”
#Text=“ Geewholliker , that would bust me , and make me a financial wreck as the papers say . ”
#Text=“ How did you lose your fortune and get reduced to blacking boots ? ” asked Rodney jocosely .
#Text=“ I got scooped out of it in Wall Street , ” answered Mike .
#Text=“ Jay Gould cleaned me out . ”
#Text=“ And I suppose now he has added your fortune to his . ”
#Text=“ You ’ve hit it boss . ”
#Text=“ Well , good day , Mike , I ’ll see you again some day -- -- ”
#Text=“ All right ! I ’m in my office all de mornin ’ . ”
#Text=CHAPTER VI .
#Text=AN IMPUDENT ADVENTURER .
#Text=While Rodney was talking with Mike Flynn he was an object of attention to a man who stood near the corner of Barclay Street , and was ostensibly looking in at the window of the drug store .
#Text=As Rodney turned away he recognized him at once as his enterprising fellow traveler who had taken possession of the casket of jewels .
#Text=He did not care to keep up an acquaintance with him , and started to cross the street .
#Text=But the other came forward smiling , and with a nod said :
#Text=“ I believe you are the young man I met yesterday in the cars and afterwards at Kentville ? ”
